issues.description: The problem statement and solution define a Farm method feedAllAnimals(), but the template's Main (commented example) calls farm.feed(), and the template Farm.java does not provide a feed() method. This name/signature mismatch between the example usage in the template and the specified API (feedAllAnimals) can confuse students who try to uncomment and run the provided Main or follow the example: they will either see a compile error (method not found) or be unsure which method name to implement.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the template example and the Farm API consistent. Either update the commented example in template Main.java to call farm.feedAllAnimals() (matching the problem statement and solution), or provide a feed() method in the template Farm that delegates to feedAllAnimals(). Prefer updating the example to use feedAllAnimals() to match the specification and reference solution.

issues.description: The problem statement and the solution refer to a Farm method named feedAllAnimals(), but the template's Main.java (commented test code) calls farm.feed(). This naming mismatch (feed vs feedAllAnimals) refers to the same conceptual operation (feed all animals) and may confuse students when mapping the textual requirements to the starter code or the expected solution. Students looking for a feedAllAnimals() method in the template might be uncertain whether to implement feed(), feedAllAnimals(), or both.
issues.suggested_fix: Unify the name across artifacts. Update the template Main.java to call farm.feedAllAnimals() (replacing farm.feed()), or alternatively add a feed() delegating method in the template Farm class that calls feedAllAnimals(). Prefer using feedAllAnimals() consistently to match the problem statement and the solution.
